alert.note: Alert for Shannon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 14 at 1:58PM CDT until April 16 at 2:12AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Missouri, including the following county, Shannon. * WHEN...Until 600 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 157 PM CDT, River gauge reports indicated minor flooding is ongoing. - This includes the following low water crossings... Thomas Hollow at Highway H, Sycamore Creek at Highway H, Carr Creek at Highway HH, Mahans Creek at County Road 501 and Rocky Creek at Highway NN. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Winona, Birch Tree, Eminence, Montier, West Eminence and Alley Spring. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
